Robert (Rob) is the Director of Business Statistics and lecturer in the Department of Statistics at Indiana University. His research is on statistical techniques such as capture-recapture and Bayesian approaches with focus on applications to human rights.

In 2012, Rob earned his Bachelor's degree from Indiana University with majors in Economics, Mathematics, and Political Science and a minor in Religious Studies. Two years later, he earned his Master's Degree in Economics and began tutoring college students professionally in the subjects of economics and statistics. Later, Rob returned to Indiana University in the Department of Statistics as a PhD student under the guidance of Professor Daniel Manrique-Vallier. In 2025, Rob earned the degree of PhD in Statistical Science and published his dissertation: [*Capture-Recapture with Covariates: The Bayesian Logistic Capture-Recapture Model with Extensions*](https://www.proquest.com/docview/3256801973).

Rob was hired in 2024 as the Director of Business Statistics and Lecturer in the Department of Statistics at Indiana University. His primary duty is overseeing the course of *STAT-S301: Applied Statistical Methods for Business*, a required course for Kelley Business School majors, for which roughly \~2000 students take per year. In addition, he regularly teaches up to three large sections of STAT-S301 per semester.

In his spare time, Rob enjoys spending time with his wife, Mary, his 4 year old son, Theodore, and his 5-month old daughter, Amelia.
